entry.title: All but 2 points of Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization deal agreed upon

media:group.media:title: All but 2 points of Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization deal agreed upon
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs foreign minister, Ararat Mirzoyan, compared the 1915 Armenian Genocide with Azerbaijan‚Äôs ethnic cleansing of Nagorno-Karabakh that happened last year. üìç Azerbaijan says it wants the European Union monitoring mission to leave Armenia and calls it a concern toward regional peace. üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan warns that rejecting Soviet-era maps for border delimitation would be dangerous to Armenia‚Äôs statehood. üìç Former airport manager maintains a farm at an abandoned runway in Jermuk: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/809113/former-airport-manager-maintains-a-farm-at-an-abandoned-runway-in-jermuk/

entry.title: TAP leads discussion on media integrity and reform in Armenia

media:group.media:title: TAP leads discussion on media integrity and reform in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Leading media figures and democracy advocates gathered in Yerevan this week to urge clarity, transparency, and independence in Armenia‚Äôs proposed media self-regulation law. In a series of lively discussions organized by The Armenia Project (TAP), local and international experts emphasized the importance of creating a landscape that promotes ethical journalism, combats disinformation, and deepens media literacy. The event comes as Armenia‚Äôs parliament prepares to finalize amendments to the Law on Mass Media.

entry.title: Understanding the fall of Assad regime

media:group.media:title: Understanding the fall of Assad regime
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian delves into three distinct yet interconnected developments shaping the geopolitical landscape of the Caucasus and beyond. He first examines Armenia's plans to construct a new highway connecting the Kajaran and Sisian regions. Hacopian then pivots to analyze the deepening political crisis in neighboring Georgia, assessing the strengths and weaknesses of the country's pro-Western opposition forces. Finally, he offers his perspective on the unfolding collapse of the Assad regime in Syria and the potential reverberations across the Middle East and the wider region.

media:group.media:description:
C‚Äôest donc la fin de la dynastie Al Assad en Syrie. Fin novembre, le groupe islamiste Hayat Tahrir Al-Cham (HTC) lance une offensive sur la seconde ville de Syrie Alep. En quelques jours, Alep s‚Äôest retrouv√©s sous le contr√¥le de la faction islamiste. De ville en ville, les rebelles ont finalement conquis Damas, la capitale. Bachar Al Assad, le pr√©sident autocratique, a fui le pays. Les Syriens ont c√©l√©br√© leur lib√©ration du dirigeant tyrannique. entry.title: Aurora leaders on the transformative power of education

media:group.media:title: Aurora leaders on the transformative power of education
media:group.media:description:
Partner content.
A discussion on the right to education took place at the Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum in Los Angeles this year. Organized by the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative in collaboration with UCLA‚Äôs The Promise Institute for Human Rights, the event brought together global leaders in education and social equity. Louise Richardson, the President of Carnegie Corporation of New York and Aurora Prize Selection Committee Member, moderated the conversation. The panel featured CEO and Co-Founder of Teach for All Wendy Kopp, Professor of Law Anna Spain Bradley, Founder of the MV Foundation Shantha Sinha, and the inaugural Aurora Prize Laureate Marguerite Barankitse.

entry.title: Armenia, France sign new defense cooperation plan

media:group.media:title: Armenia, France sign new defense cooperation plan
media:group.media:description:
üìç Non-partisan candidate Sarik Minasyan won an open primary election held by the ruling Civil Contract party and will become the interim mayor of Gyumri, Armenia‚Äôs second largest city. He will serve until the upcoming spring elections. üìç No provision of the Armenian Constitution contains territorial claims against its neighbors, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan reiterated. üìç The Armenia-France Defense Cooperation Program for the upcoming year was signed by the Armenian Ministry of Defense. üìç Armenia must reform state secrets law, new TI report says- https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/808852/armenia-must-reform-state-secrets-law-new-ti-report-says/

entry.title: Ethical Journalism: Values Worth Fighting For

media:group.media:title: Ethical Journalism: Values Worth Fighting For
media:group.media:description:
Susan McKay, Ireland‚Äôs Press Ombudsperson, joins host Eric Hacopian to discuss how to promote ethical journalism at a time when the field is beset by distrust and disinformation. McKay shares her experience promoting the principles of traditional journalism through press councils that adjudicate complaints about reporting and how they can help build trust in the media and protect democracy.

entry.title: Aurora panelists share insights on global displacement

media:group.media:title: Aurora panelists share insights on global displacement
media:group.media:description:
Partner content
During a panel discussion at the Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum in Los Angeles in May 2024, experts, lawyers, and activists gathered to discuss the global refugee crisis, the rise in forced displacement, and potential solutions . Organized by the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative in collaboration with UCLA‚Äôs The Promise Institute for Human Rights, the discussion was moderated by Nasra Ismail, U.S. Enterprise Executive Director at Alight. Speakers included UCLA Law Professor Ahilan Arulanantham, Founder of Empower Rez Gardi, Chief of Mission at IOM Mexico Dana Graber Ladek, and The Sentry Co-Founder John Prendergast.

entry.title: Former minister, army general found guilty of corruption

media:group.media:title: Former minister, army general found guilty of corruption
media:group.media:description:
üìç Yeghishe Kirakosyan, who represents Armenia‚Äôs government in international tribunals, declined to comment on Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs statement about potentially withdrawing mutual claims from international courts as part of a peace treaty with Azerbaijan. üìç Armenia‚Äôs former Minister of Emergency Situations Andranik Piloyan was sentenced today to 5 years in prison for accepting bribes, and for abuse of power, and embezzlement. üìç There have been no unusual movements of military in Armenian border-straddling areas as of late, the European Union‚Äôs monitoring mission reported, dismissing claims made by numerous Azerbaijani media outlets recently that accused Yerevan of preparing for war. üìç This Week in Business: https://youtu.be/sixKrpKxIXI?si=9MPDyke1Uvrq44N8
